p: C. zeylanicum bark (Mashhad, Iran) was subjected to hydrodistillation extraction technique to isolate its essential oil. Dried bark (20 g) was transferred to a Clevenger-type apparatus, and the extraction process was run for 3 h. The resultant essential oil was collected in clean glass vials, dried by anhydrous sodium sulfate, and stored at 4°C until analyses [ 6].
